page.title: 03INTERVIEW Holworthy Farm
page.content: Holworthy farm consists of 200 acres used for the grazing of 450 sheep and 122 beef cattle. It stands on a slope on the east side of Wimbleball reservoir with fine views out over the water. The nearest shop is at Brompton Regis, some 3 miles away where there is also the nearest telephone box and post box. The farm itself is on the phone however. There is a middle school (9-13) in Dulverton attends travelling there and back daily by car, a round trip of about 20 miles. The general state of the roads in this area is satisfactory but there is no bus service. The family goes to the races at Ralegh's cross but there are few other social events in the area. You can fish in the reservoir and there is a local branch of the Yung Farmers Club.
